publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3393u Alex Neil: Estonian Days in Scotland—That the Parliament extends a warm welcome to those taking part in "Estonian Days in Scotland", which is being held from 1 to 9 November 2005 at venues all over Scotland; believes that the extensive programme of events covering business development, cultural and sporting links is a worthy successor to the successful Scottish week in Tallinn, Estonia, that was organised in 2004; welcomes, in particular, the Foreign Minister and Culture Minister from the Estonian Government to Scotland and hopes that their visits are successful in broadening the political and cultural links between our two countries in the future; notes that Estonian and Scottish businesses have been quick to recognise the benefits to both countries in a closer relationship, and hopes that this will continue to grow in the years ahead as our small nations work together to develop fresh markets throughout the European Union and beyond.

S2M-3393*#* Alex Neil: Estonian Days in Scotland—That the Parliament extends a warm welcome to those taking part in "Estonian Days in Scotland", which is being held from 1 to 9 November 2005 at venues all over Scotland; believes that the extensive programme of events covering business development, cultural and sporting links is a worthy successor to the successful Scottish week in Tallinn, Estonia, that was organised in 2004; welcomes, in particular, the Foreign Minister and Culture Minister from the Estonian Government to Scotland and hopes that their visits are successful in broadening the political and cultural links between our two countries in the future; notes that Estonian and Scottish businesses have been quick to recognise the benefits to both countries in a closer relationship, and hopes that this will continue to grow in the years ahead as our small nations work together to develop fresh markets throughout the European Union and beyond. Supported by: Brian Adam*, Bruce Crawford*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Fergus Ewing*, Robin Harper*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Jim Mather*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Murray Tosh*, Ms Sandra White*, Richard Lochhead*, Michael Matheson*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Mr John Swinney*, Mr Stewart Maxwell* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-3393# Alex Neil: Estonian Days in Scotland—That the Parliament extends a warm welcome to those taking part in "Estonian Days in Scotland", which is being held from 1 to 9 November 2005 at venues all over Scotland; believes that the extensive programme of events covering business development, cultural and sporting links is a worthy successor to the successful Scottish week in Tallinn, Estonia, that was organised in 2004; welcomes, in particular, the Foreign Minister and Culture Minister from the Estonian Government to Scotland and hopes that their visits are successful in broadening the political and cultural links between our two countries in the future; notes that Estonian and Scottish businesses have been quick to recognise the benefits to both countries in a closer relationship, and hopes that this will continue to grow in the years ahead as our small nations work together to develop fresh markets throughout the European Union and beyond. Supported by: Brian Adam, Bruce Crawford, Roseanna Cunningham, Fergus Ewing, Robin Harper, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Jim Mather, Mr Jamie Stone, Murray Tosh, Ms Sandra White, Richard Lochhead, Michael Matheson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Jim Wallace, Mr John Swinney, Mr Stewart Maxwell
S2M-3393# Estonian Days in Scotland (lodged on 5 October 2005) Christine Grahame*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3393# Estonian Days in Scotland (lodged on 5 October 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S2M-3393# Estonian Days in Scotland (lodged on 5 October 2005) Donald Gorrie*
